entry.title: SNOW SQUALL WARNING, Bernières
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 1:21 a.m. EDT Thursday 30 March 2023

entry.title: Current Conditions: -4.8°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: Sainte-Foy - Laval University 4:00 AM EDT Thursday 30 March 2023
Temperature: -4.8°C
Humidity: 81 %
Dewpoint: -7.6°C
Air Quality Health Index: n/a

entry.title: Wednesday night: Flurries at times heavy or rain showers. Low minus 10.
entry.summary: Mainly cloudy. Rain showers and flurries beginning this evening then changing to flurries at times heavy near midnight. Risk of snow squalls overnight. Local blowing snow overnight. Snowfall amount 2 cm except 10 cm over northern sections. Wind becoming east 20 km/h gusting to 40 early this evening then southwest 40 gusting to 60 after midnight. Low minus 10. Wind chill minus 17 overnight. Forecast issued 3:45 PM EDT Wednesday 29 March 2023

entry.title: Thursday: A few flurries. High minus 3.
entry.summary: A few flurries ending in the morning then mainly cloudy. Wind west 30 km/h gusting to 50. High minus 3. Wind chill minus 20 in the morning and minus 10 in the afternoon. UV index 2 or low. Forecast issued 3:45 PM EDT Wednesday 29 March 2023

entry.title: Thursday night: A few clouds. Low minus 11.
entry.summary: Partly cloudy. Becoming clear near midnight. Wind northwest 20 km/h gusting to 40 becoming light in the evening. Low minus 11. Wind chill minus 10 in the evening and minus 16 overnight. Forecast issued 3:45 PM EDT Wednesday 29 March 2023
